intro: Securidaca rivinifolia var. seorsa, commonly known as the narrow-leaved securidaca, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Leguminosae, also known as the legume or bean family, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, fragrant flowers. The plant produces pod-like fruits that contain several seeds, which are dispersed by wind or animals. It is often found in savannas and woodland areas, thriving in well-drained soils and full sun.
